result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarred A Lapotko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and assessments within 2 years (by 6-26-17); any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

*The Court sets restitution set at zero.*
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Huber for employment. The Court has no objection to sentence being served in Outagamie County and no objection to Electronic Monitoring.
The Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jarred A Lapotko in court with Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. 

Statements made as to sentencing by the state, defense, and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 40 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 3 DAYS time served and Huber privileges for employment.  The Court has no objection to sentence being served in Outagamie County and no objection to Electronic Monitoring.

The Court sets restitution at zero.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and assessments within 2 years (by 6-26-17); any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Character letters (x6).

Defendant Jarred A Lapotko in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz. Nick Cerwin for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant has a pending case in Racine and defense is requesting this case be set after that one. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/26/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Jarred A Lapotko in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.   David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Defendant has a pending matter in Racine.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jarred A Lapotko in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Ronald Dague for David J. Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jarred A Lapotko in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
